photo.title: Milan Cathedral (Duomo di Milano)

photo.description: Il Duomo di Milano, monumento simbolo del capoluogo lombardo, è la quarta chiesa d'Europa per superficie. Realizzata in marmo bianco, si estende su una lunghezza di 158 metri ed è larga 66 metri con una superficie coperta totale di 11.700 mq. L’altezza massima dal suolo è di oltre 108 metri. Nel 1386 l’arcivescovo Antonio da Saluzzo ne avviò la costruzione. Alle iniziali forme gotico-lombarde nel 1387 il duca Gian Galeazzo Visconti preferì una definita ispirazione gotica. La facciata, iniziata dall'anno 1567, fu costruita nello stile classico-barocco e solo nell'anno 1805 ne furono conclusi i lavori. Lo stile del Duomo, essendo il risultato di interventi durati 6 secoli, non risponde a una precisa espressione architettonica ma si ispira piuttosto un'idea reinterpretativa di "gotico" monumentale e verticale. Nonostante ciò si presenta come un organismo unitario. Guglie e pinnacoli non hanno funzione portante e furono episodicamente aggiunti nel corso del tempo, fino al completamento del coronamento all’inizio del XIX secolo. Immagine panoramica realizzata assemblando 6 fotografie e coprendo un angolo di circa 120 gradi Milan - The Duomo (with an unusual perspective) The Duomo of Milan is dedicated to Santa Maria Nascente, and it is the fourth church of Europe for its size. It represents the most important work of Gothic architecture in Italy. Made of white marble, it extends over a length of 158 meters and 66 meters wide with a total covered area of 11,700 sqm. The maximum height above the ground is 108 meters. In 1386 the archbishop Antonio da Saluzzo started the construction of the building but the original Gothic-Lombard style was turned in a firm footprint Gothic in 1387 by the duke Gian Galeazzo Visconti. The facade, which started since 1567, was built in classical baroque but it were concluded only in the year 1805 inspired to Gothic order. Being the result of intervention lasted six centuries the style of the Cathedral not respond to a precise architectural expression but to an inspired reinterpretation idea of "Gothic" monumental style. Despite its story now it looks like a body structural unit. Pinnacles are not load bearing and were occasionally added along the centuries, until the completion in the nineteenth century. Panoramic image made by assembling 6 photographs covering an angle of about 120 degrees
photo.tags: milano lombardia italia duomo italy milan chiesa church gotico gothic cathedral medioevo middleage architettura panoramica pano autostich merge photomerge fotopanoramica flickraward expressyourselfaward panoramafotográfico greatphotographers canonpowershotsx1is
photo.title: Milano - Il Duomo (con una prospettiva inconsueta)

photo.description: O Duomo de Milan (1386-1805), é una catedral gótica. E un templo de grandes dimensios, de cinco naves, unha central e duas laterais de cada lado, con ó menos corenta pilares atravesada por un transepto seguido polo coro e o ábside. A nave central ten 45 metros. E a segunda catedral católica romana máis grande do mundo por dielante da catedral de Sevilla e por trás da basílica de San Pedro, en Roma. Ten 157 metros de largo e pode albergar 40.000 persoas no seu interior. As fiestras maiores do coro teñen a reputación de ser as mais grandes do mundo. A verdade é que me sigue sorprendendo que estas maravillas se fixeran casi só con man de obra humana e sen as máquinas e programas de ordenador que hai hoxe en día. Fantástica!!!
photo.tags: duomo catedral cathedral milan milano italia italy gotico ladrillo marmolrosa lombardía olétusfotos
photo.title: IL Duomo.

photo.description: Galleria Vittorio Emmanuele II, Piazza Duomo, Mediolan, 31 sierpnia 2012 r. Wraz z przebudową placu przed katedrą, powstawały okalające go budynki. Fasada galerii handlowej, nazwanej imieniem pierwszego króla zjednoczonych Włoch, wybudowana została w latach 1864-67. ** Galleria Vittorio Emmanuele II, Piazza Duomo, Milan, August 31, 2012 Along the redesign of the cathedral square, the surrounding buildings were constructed. The facade of the shopping mall, named after the first king of the united Italy, was built in 1864-67.

photo.description: Milan Cathedral (Italian: Duomo di Milano; Milanese: Domm de Milan) is the cathedral church of Milan in Lombardy, northern Italy. It is the seat of the Archbishop of Milan, currently Cardinal Dionigi Tettamanzi. The Gothic cathedral took five centuries to complete and is the fourth-largest church in the world. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milan_Cathedral

photo.description: Milan Cathedral (Duomo di Milano) is the cathedral church of Milan, Italy. Dedicated to Santa Maria Nascente (Saint Mary Nascent), it is the seat of the Archbishop of Milan, currently Cardinal Angelo Scola. The Gothic cathedral took nearly six centuries to complete. It is the fourth largest cathedral in the world and the largest in the Italian state territory.

photo.description: Deze wereldberoemde kathedraal is met zijn lengte van 157 meter de één na grootste Rooms-katholieke kathedraal. De bouw van de Duomo Santa Maria Nascente werd begonnen in 1386 en is pas in de 20e eeuw definitief voltooid. De gotische façade is wereldberoemd en telt ongeveer 135 pinakels en meer dan 2300 beelden in wit marmer. This world famous cathedral is, with its length of 157 meters the second biggest catholic cathedral in the world. Building of the Duomo Santa Maria Nascente started in 1386 and is finished only in the 20th century. The gotic façade is world famous and counts approximately 135 pinacles and more than 2300 sculptures in white marble.

photo.description: The dome in Milano, Italy Milan Cathedral (Italian: Duomo di Milano; Milanese: Domm de Milan) is the cathedral church of Milan in Lombardy, northern Italy. It is the seat of the Archbishop of Milan, currently Cardinal Dionigi Tettamanzi. Milan's layout, with streets either radiating from the Duomo or circling it, reveals that the Duomo occupies the most central site in Roman Mediolanum, that of the public basilica facing the forum. Saint Ambrose's 'New Basilica' was built on this site at the beginning of the 5th century, with an adjoining basilica added in 836. When a fire damaged both buildings in 1075, they were rebuilt as the Duomo. Info from wikipedia.org

photo.description: Looking up the towering and richly decorated front facade of the Duomo di Milano. The Duomo took half a millennium to build. It was largely completed in the 1880s, when national pride focused more resources on such projects, but even now, in the 21st century, there remain some uncarved blocks to be turned into sculptures.

photo.description: Fishing through and cleaning up some oldies. This is from the Duomo in Milan, Italy, Spring, 2001. I really like the flowers. And, sadly, in a few years I'll say the same thing about what I'm shooting now :-).

photo.description: Gargoyle and statue on the facade of the Duomo di Milano.
photo.tags: italia italy milano milan cathedral duomodimilano milancathedral gargoyle
photo.title: Duomo artwork

photo.description: The Duomo di Milano is the third largest church building in the world, after the Cathedral of Seville and St Peter's Basilica in Rome, with a capacity of 40 thousand people. This is the view of the choir and apse. Notice the red light high above the large choir window. It shows the location of a ceiling vault with a box containing a sacred iron nail that supposedly was used for the Crucifixion of Christ. Once a year, in September, this box is brought down to great reverence.
photo.tags: italy italia milan milano cathedral duomodimilano milancathedral

photo.title: On top of the Cathedral of Milan

photo.description: There were restoration works in progress on the facade of the Cathedral, and those works were sponsored in part by the bank that covered the workers doing their thing with that sign depicting a rendering of a possible scene of the plaza's life during Renaissance. In my opinion a wise way of handling it.
